alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Coal; Hughes; Johnston; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 8:49AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Johnston, Coal, south central Pontotoc, northwestern Atoka and southeastern Hughes Counties through 915 AM CDT... At 849 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bromide, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tishomingo, Coalgate, Wapanucka, Lehigh, Tupelo, Milburn, Stuart, Bromide, Centrahoma, Pontotoc, Clarita, Olney, Fillmore, Reagan, Connerville, Wardville, Coleman, Phillips, Chockie and northern Atoka Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
